breweries.description:
We are a very small brewery located in Chino, CA. We are starting out as basically just homebrewers with an outlet to share our beers with others. We brew in very small batches and currently the only place to get our beer is directly from our brewery. This allows us a great deal of freedom in variety of style and recipe selection.
 
One of the main reasons we started I & I was because it was hard to find good fresh beer around. Although there are many great breweries in the surrounding counties, San Bernardino County had very few so we decided to open our own.

breweries.name: I & I Brewing

style.description: Mild, pale, light-bodied ale, made using a warm fermentation (top or bottom) and cold lagering. Hop bitterness and flavor range from very low to low. Hop aroma is often absent. Sometimes referred to as cream ales, these beers are crisp and refreshing. Pale malt character predominates. Caramelized malt character should be absent. A fruity or estery aroma may be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.
style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager

description: Our American Style Cream Ale is not your Grandfather's Cream Ale. Made with pale and honey malts, this smooth, lightly carbonated beer balances maltiness, sweetness and distinct lager like yeast flavors. This beer is extremely drinkable and full of flavor

breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.
breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company

style.description: Mild, pale, light-bodied ale, made using a warm fermentation (top or bottom) and cold lagering. Hop bitterness and flavor range from very low to low. Hop aroma is often absent. Sometimes referred to as cream ales, these beers are crisp and refreshing. Pale malt character predominates. Caramelized malt character should be absent. A fruity or estery aroma may be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived. Sulfur character and/or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be extremely low or absent from this style of beer.
style.name: American-Style Cream Ale or Lager

name: Honey Cream Ale

description: A smooth, blond ale brewed with local honey and lagered for crispness featuring delicate hop aroma and balanced bitterness from Willamete hops.

breweries.description: Our brewers focus on high quality ingredients, a carefully controlled process and delicate handling to provide one of the best beers you will find in the industry. We operate a seven barrel brewery designed and installed by Sound Brewing Systems of Seattle with vessels fabricated by Ripley Stainless in British Columbia. Our brewery features a cold room specially designed for lagering to provide our beers with a traditional character and complexity.
breweries.name: Anacortes Brewery

breweries.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Pale Ale

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

description:
New Crispin Honey Crisp Artisanal Reserve™ is a small batch, hand crafted, super-premium hard apple cider smoothed with real organic honey for a rich, creamy, full-bodied crisp taste. Smooth over ice.
Cloudy Hard Cider™. For the discerning drinker, Honey Crisp’s artisanal style is embodied in our unique Cloudy Filtration™ process, using racked unfiltered apple wine that leaves residual natural apple wine sediment in the bottle. Every bottle should receive a full Bottoms-Up! tilt and swirl before opening and enjoying.

Naturally fermented using a premium apple juice blend, not from apple juice concentrate, with no added malt, spirit or grape alcohol. Honey Crisp is smoothed with pure organic honey, with no added sugar, colorants or sorbate or benzoate preservatives. Honey Crisp's apple juice is a fresh pressed blend of 3 to 5 different apples. We do not use the Honeycrisp apple, a very fine dessert eating apple, but in our experience and in our opinion, not a fine base for apple wine.

breweries.description:
Classically refined, but not styled as a traditional "sweet beer" beer alternative, Crispin ciders are crisp and clean, not sweet and sticky and never sacrifice superior quality refreshment satisfaction for overbearing complexity.

Always true to the apple, Crispin Hard Ciders naturally fermented in the USA use fresh pressed apple-juice, not from apple juice concentrate, from a premium blend of US West Coast apples, with no added malt, grape wine or spirit alcohol. Crispin’s unique USA produced ciders are smoothed with pure apple juice or from natural sugar sources like organic honey or organic maple syrup, and contain no added colorants, sorbate or benzoate preservatives.

Crispin ciders have 7 different varietals - Original, Light and Brut; classic European styled crisp clean ciders, Browns Lane; an imported classic English dry cider, and our line of Artisanal Reserves; Honey Crisp, The Saint and Lansdowne - unfiltered "cloudy" ciders, ground-breaking "craft beer" uniquely American ciders.

Crispin ciders are all Gluten Free for the wheat-intolerant person.
breweries.name: Crispin Cider

style.description: Variable, but should be a medium, refreshing drink. Sweet ciders must not be cloying. Dry ciders must not be too austere. An ideal cider serves well as a “session” drink, and suitably accompanies a wide variety of food.
style.name: Common Cider

name: Honey Crispin

description: A light refreshing blonde Ale with over 7 Gallons of fresh honeydew melon juice in it.

description: This really is a honey of a beer. An ABV of 5.7% gives this wheaty sweetie a mild kick, while the perfect combo of honey and grains makes for a tasty buzz at the end of your busy day. If finding the perfect honey wheat beer made your to-do list, you can finally cross it off. We think this is one “chore” you’ll actually love.

A statement by the brewer explaining the classic or other style of the beer, and the type of honey used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions.

description: Honey Do Golden Ale is a lighter bodied golden ale with a slight sweet honey flavor.  We blended honey malt and local beekeeper honey to give this beer a subtle honey taste with a distinctive Saaz hop spiciness.  This warm weather ale offers easy drinkability for those new to craft beers but still provides plenty of flavor for craft beer lovers.

breweries.description: Over 26 years, Stoudts Brewing Company has grown and evolved from a small brewery with limited draught distribution, to a packaging regional microbrewery with distribution in 17 different states, producing over 10,000 barrels a year. Even with the growth over the years, one thing has always remained constant, and that is the attention to detail that goes into every batch of handcrafted beer that is traditionally brewed, packaged and sold with passion by our small team of hardworking dedicated employees. A tradition that was started by Ed and Carol Stoudt who both continue to spread the gospel of craft beer!

locations.hoursOfOperation: Ed Stoudt's free tour: Sat. 3 pm and Sun. 1 pm

breweries.name: Stoudts Brewery

style.description: The German word helle means light colored, and as such, a heller Bock is light straw to deep golden in color. Maibocks are also light-colored bocks. The sweet malty character should come through in the aroma and flavor. A lightly toasted and/or bready malt character is often evident. Roast or heavy toast/caramel malt character should be absent. Body is medium to full. Hop bitterness should be low, while noble-type hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Bitterness increases with gravity. Fruity esters may be perceived at low levels. Diacetyl should be absent. Chill haze should not be perceived.
style.name: German-Style Heller Bock/Maibock

breweries.description: Beer, Farm Fresh. Persephone’s 11-acre farm-based brewery prides itself on the FRESHEST BEER. We grow our own hops and use BC grain in every sip. Not content with simply making the best and freshest beer, Persephone is committed to making the world a better place through early adoption of ecologically positive systems and working as a social venture to employ people who need it most. Every can, glass, growler or keg you purchase helps us achieve these goals as a team, which now includes YOU! Thank you for your support and ENJOY THIS BEER!
breweries.name: Persephone Brewing Company

breweries.description:
Today, we're a team of about 750 people, and we all share a common passion for bringing great Samuel Adams beers to beer lovers everywhere. We've worked hard and are incredibly proud of the many successes we've enjoyed over the years. The Boston Beer Company has been cited as one of the best companies to work for by Boston Magazine, one of the Best Entry-Level Jobs by The Princeton Review, and our beers have won more awards than any other in history. Jim has been named an "Entrepreneur of the Year" by Inc. Magazine. Our brewers keep amazing us with innovative new brews, including Samuel Adams Utopias and our Samuel Adams Barrel Room Collection.

Jim has believed from the beginning that the more you know and understand about beer, the more you'll appreciate a beer like Samuel Adams Boston Lager. To begin that mission, all new employees go through intensive training on everything from ingredients, brewing, and beer styles, to taking care of the beer once it leaves the brewery. We're all beer lovers and protectors of the beer so we're trained how to identify off flavors and how to troubleshoot the causes. The passion for beer continues with an annual homebrew competition that we all take part in.

One of our wholesalers once asked Jim why he invested so much in training his people, when ultimately they might leave. Jim smiled and replied without hesitation: "What if I didn't train them, and they stayed?"

Each year, usually in January, everyone gathers together. One of the highlights of the meeting is the beer trivia contest. With a culture so steeped in beer education and knowledge, winning is a pretty big deal. Recently, one of the hotel bartenders who was watching as the various teams arrived in costume with music and much enthusiasm and fanfare, said, "I've always known Samuel Adams made the best beer in America, but now I see this is the greatest company in America." When you look around you see that The Boston Beer Company is a team of enthusiastic people who are passionate about beer and who really love coming to work every day to provide American drinkers with the best beer possible.

The Boston Beer Company, Inc. is a publicly-traded company listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol, SAM.
breweries.name: Boston Beer Company

style.description: These beers are brewed using honey in addition to malted barley. Beers may be brewed to a traditional style or may be experimental. Character of honey should be evident in flavor and aroma and balanced with the other components without overpowering them. A statement by the brewer explaining the classic or other style of the beer, and the type of honey used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions.
style.name: Specialty Honey Lager or Ale

description:
A fine traditional ale with a hint of summer sweetness.

A light, golden coloured refreshing ale made using finest pale crushed malt, the dwarf variety hop First Gold and local Yorkshire Honey. This provides a well-balanced hoppy beer with a pleasant honey aftertaste.

Honey Gold can be enjoyed at any time of year but on a hot summers' day it's the bees knees!

style.description: These beers are brewed using honey in addition to malted barley. Beers may be brewed to a traditional style or may be experimental. name: Honey Gold

description: Though no honey went into this beer, it has a wonderfully deep honey color.  A slight spiced flavor reminiscent of a light summer Belgian.

breweries.description:
Salish Sea Brewing Co. is focused on providing the best the region has to offer in fine hand-crafted ales and lagers.

Jeff and Erika are regular people with real dreams. Erika and Jeff were friends in early college years who found each other later, dated, got married, started a family, then asked each other, “What do you really want to do in life…(when you grow up)?”  They liked beer, liked making beer, liked having a good time, and liked sharing their likes with others.

Their first homebrew settings were humble: Jeff’s nose sticking deep into a carboy of fermenting beer in a friend's small apartment.

They evolved from the stove top with extract batches, to setting up a small, all-grain batch brewery (8 gallon kettles - Thanksgiving turkey frying pots -  on propane burners with converted coolers for mash tuns) on the back porch,  to bigger and bigger goals.  From a 5 gallon pot on the stove (with a batch of extract syrup), to a 10 gallon converted cooler (with cracked grain), and kegs turned to kettles, to working on a 15 barrel brewery creating batches that go state to state, national, international...  They made batches at home for themselves, their friends, for weddings, parties, etc..  and realized this is what they wanted to do for a job.   Jeff apprenticed with a professional brewer (local celebrity Skip Madsen of Pike, Boundary Bay, American, etc…) and learned the pro angle of the trade.   They have seen the evolution, gone through it, appreciate it, and are happy to be where they are today.

Salish Sea Brewing Co. is a 10 bbl (310 gallon per batch) establishment.  We hope to brew twice a week, offering a variety of ales and the occasional lager and pilsner. 

Jeff and Erika have a  6-year-old little girl and a 2-year-old son.  They are family oriented and hope for the brewery to be family approachable.   Families are welcome, but this is a brewery with a tasting room, not a playground (we do not cater to children).  Please respect our space and the space of others.  Minors must be accompanied by an adult. 

Our roots are solid, our goals are lofty, but our dreams, aspirations, and hopes are high.  We want to create a place to showpiece our beers, invite your friends and families, and for you all to have a great time.

The Salish Sea Brewing Company is the real deal!

We have three 10bbl fermenters in place, the 10bbl bright tank, kettle, and mash up and running!  Please join us for a beer soon.

description: Lightly spiced characteristics with warm cider notes, brewed with local raw honey and honey malt adding a layer of complexity. The full fall flavors and hidden high alcohol level makes this rich autumnal ale one to be sipped until passing out in the leaves.

style.description: Light amber to mid-range brown in color, strong ales are medium to full bodied with a malty sweetness and may have low levels of roast malt character. Hop aroma should be minimal and flavor can vary from none to medium in character intensity. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas can contribute to the character of this ale. Bitterness should be minimal but evident and balanced with malt and/or caramel-like sweetness. Alcohol types can be varied and complex. A rich, often sweet and complex estery character may be evident. Very low levels of diacetyl are acceptable. Chill haze is acceptable at low temperatures. (This style may often be split into two categories, strong and very strong.)
style.name: Strong Ale

name: Honey Harvest

breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

style.description: Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma. Alcohol content is medium-high to high and notably evident. They range from deep golden to medium copper in color. The style may use any variety of hops. Though the hop character is intense it's balanced with complex alcohol flavors, moderate to high fruity esters and medium to high malt character. Hop character should be fresh and lively and should not be harsh in quality. The use of large amounts of hops may cause a degree of appropriate hop haze. Imperial or Double India Pale Ales have medium-high to full body. Diacetyl should not be perceived. The intention of this style of beer is to exhibit the fresh and bright character of hops. Oxidative character and aged character should not be present.
style.name: Imperial or Double India Pale Ale

description: A classic German Hefeweizen with a touch of Canadian Honey Malt. Fermented with a German Hefeweizen yeast to produce banana and clove overtones.

style.description: The aroma and flavor of a Weissbier with yeast is decidedly fruity and phenolic. The phenolic characteristics are often described as clove-, nutmeg-like, mildly smoke-like or even vanilla-like. Banana-like esters should be present at low to medium-high levels. These beers are made with at least 50 percent malted wheat, and hop rates are quite low. Hop flavor and aroma are absent or present at very low levels. Weissbier is well attenuated and very highly carbonated and a medium to full bodied beer. The color is very pale to pale amber. Because yeast is present, the beer will have yeast flavor and a characteristically fuller mouthfeel and may be appropriately very cloudy. No diacetyl should be perceived.
style.name: South German-Style Hefeweizen / Hefeweissbier

name: Honey Hefe

description: By far our most famous brew, Honey Hips’ stands alone. A pale golden color with a frothy, ample head, the aroma is floral honey and spicy citrus. Light and earthy flavors with a touch of malt sweetness in the front, it will leave you begging for the back. Her clean finish leaves Honey Hips extremely drinkable, but use caution, this blonde is strong enough to make your head swim.

breweries.description: Regardless of the people and events, however, Latitude 33 is always synonymous with “Adventure” — which is also our brewing philosophy. We’re on an exploration that involves taking a few risks, trying new things and injecting a little of the unexpected into the world of craft beer. If you’re up for it, we’d like to invite you to come along. Just meet us at Latitude 33.

breweries.description: Brite Eyes Brewing Co. is a microbrewery/coffeehouse located in Kalamazoo, MI. We feature a deli style menu, locally roasted espresso drinks, and our signature hand crafted ales. We brew our beer on a small 1 barrel system, which allows us the flexibility to create a rotating tap list of experimental ales, as well as our main stay beers. Our family friendly tap room features high ceilings, lively colors, and a beautiful view of downtown Kalamazoo.
breweries.name: Brite Eyes Brewing Company

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

description: Our Honey I'm Home Blonde Ale is a light easy drinking blonde with hints of sage and wildflower from the local organic honey used in the boil.

breweries.description:
Beer. Food. Music. It is based on these fundamental ingredients - the trifecta of entertainment - that The LAB Brewing Co. was born.  We take them all -- our beer, our food, and our music-- equally seriously. And we take great effort to combine them all to create a haven for all who share our appreciation for drinking, eating and being merry.

Beer lovers rejoice. With more than 25 handpicked microbrews on tap we have you covered. And that’s before adding our house brews, handcrafted by our brewmaster on site to the mix. From the aggressively hopped IPA Bad Influence to the oh-so-strong Take Her Home Belgian Tripel, our house brews not only pack a punch, but they are sure to awaken your taste buds. Beer aficionados and casual drinkers are encouraged to seek out our head brewer Roger for a tour of the premises or to talk shop.

Large stunning copper fermentation vessels align the restaurant and contribute to a unique dining experience. The setting is a perfect match for our eclectic American cuisine. Menu favorites include BBQ duck quesadilla, white lasagna and Alaskan cod in a hazelnut sage brown butter sauce. No, this isn’t your typical “bar food” – though the LAB Burger is to die for. Everything is fresh farm to table.
breweries.name: The Lab Brewing Company

style.description: Golden or Blonde ales are straw to golden blonde in color. They have a crisp, dry palate, light to medium body, and light malt sweetness. Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze should be absent.
style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale

name: Honey I'm Home Blonde

breweries.description:
Saugatuck Brewing Co. is a traditional Irish style pub that features 15 house-made drafts, hard cider and wines. All beer is produced on site in our 13,000 square foot Brew House. The full menu includes light snacks and unique entrees, along with home made desserts.  We offer 6 mainstay styles in bottles along with 3 seasonals and many specialties.

We feature the only brew-on-site facility in West Michigan. With five copper kettles, an array of natural ingredients, and over 100 recipes, we invite you and your friends to be the Brewmaster for a day. Create your own unique ale and return in two weeks to bottle 60 - 22 oz. bottles of fresh beer with a custom label of your choice.

The Singapore Room is our multi-purpose banquet facility. This includes a 4 tap bar, wine service and customizable menus. The Singapore Room can be rented out for a variety of events including birthdays, graduations, weddings, rehearsal dinners, etc.
breweries.name: Saugatuck Brewing Company

style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale
style.name: American-Style India Pale Ale

style.description: American-style India pale ales are perceived to have medium-high to intense hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content. The style is further characterized by floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American-variety hop character. Note that one or more of these American-variety hop characters is the perceived end, but the hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. The use of water with high mineral content results in a crisp, dry beer. This pale gold to deep copper-colored ale has a full, flowery hop aroma and may have a strong hop flavor (in addition to the perception of hop bitterness). India pale ales possess medium maltiness which contributes to a medium body. Fruity-ester flavors and aromas are moderate to very strong. Diacetyl can be absent or may be perceived at very low levels. Chill and/or hop haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and citrus-like American hops are considered enough of a distinction justifying separate American-style IPA and English-style IPA categories or subcategories. Hops of other origins may be used for bitterness or approximating traditional American or English character. See English-style India Pale Ale

description: Named for all the… wait, that is only late editions of citra hops that give this brew it’s citrus aroma and flavor! A touch of Honey Malt gives this beer a slight sweetness up front, with just enough bitterness to balance it all out. This is the beer that started it all for us here at UBC!

breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.description:
Big Top Brewing Company is a Sarasota based production brewery. Proudly distributed by Coastal Beverage, Gold Coast Eagle Distributing, Great Bay Distributing, and Pepin Distributing Company.

Having lived here all our lives we know the history behind our beautiful town. Typically seen as a tourist destination for beaches, weather and art, Big Top plans to add world renown beer manufacture to those well deserved titles. We look forward to crafting the best beer, in the best town and showcasing it with the best artwork designed by Ringling School of Art and Design graduates.
breweries.name: Big Top Brewing Company

Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. breweries.description: Owners David and Brenda Simmons had a plan to expand their winery business with a restaurant. Several of the wine customers are also beer drinkers. What better way to satisfy all customers than to offer fresh locally produced beer. Opening in Sept. of 2012, 450 North Brewing Company will open as a Brewpub with a full service restaurant.
breweries.name: 450 North Brewing Company

description: Clear with a bright, straw-yellow hue, slightly hoppy with some added sweetness on the backend from honey grown locally in Indiana. The Kolsch Yeast exhibits some of the fruity character of an ale, with a clean lager-like finish.

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.
style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

name: Honey Kolsch

description: This German-style Kölsch ale is brewed with pilsner malt, hops and yeast from Germany. American honey malt accents the more delicate flavors and provides balance. Hints of honey, white wine, fresh pears and clean spring water are present but none dominate. This brew is decidedly crisp and refreshing.

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

locations.name: Rogue Ales at the Portland Airport

breweries.name: Rogue Ales

description:
We grow bees. Taste the difference

Ale brewed with Rogue Farms hopyard honey. Situated just across from 40 acres of Rogue hops, 7,140,289 Rogue Farms bees are carefully kept and fed and the honey is uncapped, extracted, filtered and finally infused into a refreshing Honey Kolsch Ale.

breweries.description:
The Brewery was built in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada in 1927 and operated under the name of Hub City Brewing Company. The plant became the Western Canada Brewing Company in 1930 and then Drewery’s Limited in 1932. 

The capacity of the Brewery at that time was 72 bottles per minute. Compare that to today’s 360 bottles and 480 cans per minute. 

The Brewery was acquired in 1956 and operated as O’Keefe Brewing until 1989. When Carling O’Keefe amalgamated with Molson Brewing Company, the intended closure created an opportunity for the employees. 

The employees pooled their resources and in 1989 formed the Great Western Brewing Company. Now with a management-led employee group, the Great Western Brewing Company is one of Canada’s most successful regional brewers and an internationally recognized producer of world-class beer.
breweries.name: Great Western Brewing Company

style.description: These beers are brewed using honey in addition to malted barley. Beers may be brewed to a traditional style or may be experimental. A statement by the brewer explaining the classic or other style of the beer, and the type of honey used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions.

breweries.description:
Galaxy Brewing Co. was founded in 2011 by a local father and son brewing team who are dedicated to producing the finest craft ales. Galaxy Brewing Co. and brewpub represent the culmination of their life long aspiration to deliver quality beer to Binghamton and beyond. We are dedicated to producing the finest craft beer and excellent food using as much locally sourced products as possible. Look for our grand opening in spring of 2012!

Galaxy will be located in the old Phil’s Gift Shop location on the Metrocenter Mall. Our address is 41 Court St/153 & 157 Washington St. Binghamton, NY 13901. We are very proud to be part of the efforts to revitalize Downtown Binghamton and to be able to be in the building that housed such a Binghamton landmark as Phil’s Gifts.

description: Delicate, golden, light-bodied, Fully attenuated ale with fruity and spicy flavor notes imparted by the addition of premium clover honey to the kettle. Made with pure Syracuse water, American pale malts, select British ale yeast and 4 hops varieties: Clusters, Cascades, Fuggles and Bullion. Naturally aged slowly, without finings or filtration, for a minimum of 1 month to develop its full flavor and clarity.

breweries.description:
The Syracuse Suds Factory was founded on January 19th, 1993. It is located in the historic Amos Building in downtown Syracuse, New York. The Syracuse Suds Factory became the first commercial brewery in Syracuse after 31 years. Our first beer was brewed on March 20, 1993 and first tapped on April 17, 1993. At this time we were the only brewery in Syracuse, New York.

The Syracuse Suds Factory also has the claim of being the first brewery, in Syracuse New York, in 31 years to commercially ship its product to other outlets. On May 7th 1995 we shipped our first keg to Jack London's, a pub in Sidney New York. From that point on we have shipped to other accounts outside of Syracuse as well as local accounts.
breweries.name: Syracuse Suds Factory

American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

They jumped in head first and committed their minimal financial resources and made it happen.

description:
What goes better with honey than bread? Well, have you tried honey with malted barley, perfectly balanced with American hops for a refreshing twist?

Honey Matrimony is made with wildflower honey from Clark’s Honey Farm in Evans, Colorado, and base malts from Colorado Malting Company in Alamosa. By starting with a well balanced American brown ale, our proprietary techniques allows the delicate aroma and flavors of honey to come through perfectly. So raise your glass and give a toast to the perfect marriage of ingredients from the best place on earth.
name: Honey Matrimony Brown Ale

style.description: American brown ales range from deep copper to brown in color. Roasted malt caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be of medium intensity in both flavor and aroma. American brown ales have evident low to medium hop flavor and aroma, medium to high hop bitterness, and a medium body. Estery and fruity-ester characters should be subdued. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Brown Ale

breweries.description: At Blue Moon Brewing Company®, we believe brewing is an art. And it’s been that way since our head brewmaster and founder, Keith Villa, first created Blue Moon® Belgian White Belgian-Style Wheat Ale back in 1995 in downtown Denver, Colorado.

locations.hoursOfOperation: Now only open during Rockies home games.

description:
Ale brewed with honey & orange peel. 
Welcome the season with Honey Moon Summer Ale, the winner of the gold medal in the Specialty Honey Lager or Ale category at the Great American Beer Festival 2006. This ale is brewed with clover honey, orange peel, pale malt and malted white wheat. Compliment any summer gathering with this crisp, refreshing ale.

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

name: Honey Moon Summer Ale

breweries.description:
We have proud roots in home brewing and North Carolina, and we have been humbly perfecting some of our favorite recipes over the last 10 years.  We are incredibly excited to share them in the months to come.  Justin was born and raised here in Charlotte, and we couldn’t be happier for our brewery to become part of the city's dynamic and growing craft beer scene.  

If you love good beer as much as we do, we can't wait to have you join us in the taproom for a pint or two.  It's not long until we're pouring.
breweries.name: Sycamore Brewing

style.description: American amber/red ales range from light copper to light brown in color. They are characterized by American-variety hops used to produce the perception of medium hop bitterness, flavor, and medium aroma. Amber ales have medium-high to high maltiness with medium to low caramel character. They should have medium to medium-high body. The style may have low levels of fruityester flavor and aroma. Diacetyl can be either absent or barely perceived at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. Slight yeast haze is acceptable for bottle-conditioned products.
style.name: American-Style Amber/Red Ale

description: A blonde ale brewed with Colorado honey and aged on almonds.

style.description: These beers are brewed using unusual fermentable sugars, grains and starches that contribute to alcohol content other than, or in addition to, malted barley. Nuts generally have some degree of fermentables, thus beers brewed with nuts would appropriately be entered in this category. The distinctive characters of these special ingredients should be evident either in the aroma, flavor or overall balance of the beer, but not necessarily in overpowering quantities. For example, maple syrup or potatoes would be considered unusual. Rice, corn, or wheat are not considered unusual. Special ingredients must be listed when competing. A statement by the brewer explaining the special nature of the beer, ingredient(s) and achieved character is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. If this beer is a classic style with some specialty ingredient(s), the brewer should also specify the classic style. Guidelines for competing: Spiced beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the experimental category. Fruit beers using unusual fermentables should be entered in the fruit beer category.
style.name: Specialty Beer

name: Honey Nut Blonde

breweries.description:
Like most things, there are various ways to make mead. At Brothers Drake, our philosophy on making mead is based on the following principles:

1. Start Local: We buy local honey, support local agriculture, and produce a local product.

2. Use the Best: We look for the highest quality local product on the market, ordering from the best from the source closest to Ohio.

3. No Heat: We do not boil our honey or any water used in production. The No Heat Method keeps honey flavors true to the source and a better mead.

4. No Added Sulfites: Unlike grapes which have wild yeast growing on them, honey is naturally antiseptic and antibiotic, so no sulfites needed.

5. Build community: We share our knowledge openly and are grateful to people everywhere who ask questions, share their perspective, and engage in an open collaborative dialogue on mead-making.

6. Embrace creativity: Our mead can be paired with wonderful cheeses, appetizers, and entrees, as well as used in cooking and in mixed drinks.

These basic principles guide our craft, our partnerships, and our practices. We look forward to sharing a drink with you!
breweries.name: Brothers Drake Meadery

description: We put our dry traditional mead on oak staves to add a barrel aged character.  Strong honey on the nose gives way to caramel flavors and woody tones.  Oak rounds out the dry finish.  Honey Oak complements anything on the grill.  Goes nicely with conversation at the bar.

style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a dry white wine, with a pleasant mixture of subtle honey character, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.
style.name: Dry Mead

name: Honey Oak

description: our way of keeping in the family. It’s the little sister to our Virginia Blonde. The caramel malt and clover honey are a great combination for a light yet tasteful beer. The unnoticeable hop presence is great for those “taking it easy”.

breweries.description:
We are a small brewery that manufactures and sells beer in our tap room. We will be brewing on a 2 barrel (bbl) system when we open - 60 gallons per batch brewed.

Tin Cannon founders John Hilkert and Aaron Ludwig started out as a home brewers. John and Aaron met at church through their kids, who were (and still are) best friends. The kids would plan brew days at Aaron's house so they could play together, and John and Aaron could brew. John had started brewing on a beer kit and Aaron taught him the art of brewing all grain beers on his home made system. The planning of Tin Cannon came through many days of brewing with together in Aaron's dedicated brew room, or in John's garage. Aaron is an engineering guru and built a tremendous 10 gallon brewing system on his own, to include an electric master control panel. John likes to tinker and build stuff, and built stir plates, mash tuns, a kegerator and the like. When two innovative minds get together, they bring ingenuity, focus, style and creativity to each beer they brew. That's what you can expect to get when you come to Tin Cannon Brewing Co.
breweries.name: Tin Cannon Brewing Company

style.description: Golden or Blonde ales are straw to golden blonde in color. They have a crisp, dry palate, light to medium body, and light malt sweetness. Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze should be absent.

name: Honey of a Blonde

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.
available.name: Year Round

breweries.description:
Dedicated to Excellence
Committed to Community

With 2 unique locations in Historic Downtown West Jefferson, serves all of your dining and special event’s needs.  Our Restaurant comfortably seats over 200 guests in two separate dining areas, a private room, and a large street-side dog-friendly outdoor dining area.

Our Brew Haus just up the street is the home of Ashe County’s first and only Craft Beer Brewery.  The Brew Haus also serves as a premiere special events venue that can be customized to meet your special event needs.  We offer fully customized catering services if you already have selected a location for your event.

Our menu features locally sourced ingredients and we have daily Chef’s specials that will have you coming back for more.  With over 50 craft beers on tap between our two locations we are a must stop destination in the High Country for Craft Beer enthusiasts.
breweries.name: Boondocks Brewing

description: A kolsch style beer that is light in ABV but full of flavor. Using local honey, Honey Malt and Sweet Orange peel we've created a nice balanced beer that is drinkable through all of the seasons.

style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.
style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

name: Honey Orange Kolsch

breweries.description: MBC offers a wide variety of beer styles brewed on location and also craft beer from our favorite breweries around the world. While we offer a few flagship brews year round, our tap selection generally varies from week to week, and of course season to season. If you don’t see your favorite style, stop by and let us know what YOU would like to see us brew…If you ask for it, we will brew it!
breweries.name: Manitou Brewing Company

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.
style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison

description: Honey Orange Wheat is an unfiltered wheat beer and has flavors of honey and orange balanced with a nice medium-sweet malt character. It is medium bodied with no harsh bitterness and a nice honey-orange finish. It is made from Northwest Two-Row and Wheat Malts; Willamette Hops; #48 Oregon Wildflower Honey, Orange Juice, and Free Range Coastal Waters. It is currently available on draft.

breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

locations.name: Rogue Ales at the Portland Airport

breweries.name: Rogue Ales

style.description: This beer can be made using either ale or lager yeast. It can be brewed with 30 to 75 percent wheat malt, and hop rates may be low to medium. Hop characters may be light to moderate in bitterness, flavor and aroma. Fruity-estery aroma and flavor are typical but at low levels however, phenolic, clove-like characteristics should not be perceived. Color is usually straw to light amber, and the body should be light to medium in character. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Because this style is served with yeast the character should portray a full yeasty mouthfeel and appear hazy to very cloudy. Chill haze is also acceptable. Yeast flavor and aroma should be low to medium but not overpowering the balance and character of malt and hops. These beers are typically served with the yeast in the bottle, and are cloudy when served.
style.name: Light American Wheat Ale or Lager with Yeast

name: Honey Orange Wheat

breweries.description: We are a Reno Brewery Company with a great selection of delicious microbrew ranging from our dark porter to our honey pale ale.
breweries.name: Stoneyhead Brewing Co.

style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.
style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
